chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald F. Battin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: To remain open during the course of probation.
No contact with victim, her mother or minors that are not family, unless approved by Agent.

Provide DNA sample.
No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
Comply with all Sex Offender registration requirements of the State of Wisconsin and undergo sex offender treatment - individual and group therapy.
Comply with all mental health treatment required by the Agent.
Comply with any correctional therapy as required by the Agent.
Defendant shall not possess or view any pornography while on probation. 
Agent is to review the anger management treatement as suggested by Dr. Heinz.

records.addlTxt: from Judge Boles to Donald's request for good time. "There is no good time on jail imposed as a condition of probation".
Request to get good time on sentence filed by Defendant.

11:41  Defendant Donald F. Battin in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No corrections to the PSI by either party. Thorie requests the court follows the recomendations of the PSI. Requests restitution be left open for a time. Atty Nelson addresses. Requests jail sentence of 3 months.Court orders.  S/W Probation 5 years Conditions: 6 months jail with juber which is to be used for work and for treatment.  Jail is stayed until Sept 21, 2016 at 7:00 PM.   Court costs and supervision fees, DNA sample and Surcharge,    No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. No Contact  with the victim or the victims mother without consent of the probation agent. Compley with all mental health treatment required by the agent. Comply with any correctional therapy as required by the agent. Defendant shall not possess or view any pronography while on probation . Undergo a psychiatric examinination.  Agent is to review the anger management treatment as suggensted by Dr. Heinz. Pay restitiution which will remain open during probation.  Comply with sex offender registry and undergo sex offender treatment individual and group therapy.
Sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:03 a.m.  Defendant Donald F. Battin in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thorie - Plea to charge in amended information, PSI.  Nelson in agreement and 15 years registration. Amended Information filed with the court.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to charge in the Amended Information.    Facts are correct.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of charge in Amended Information.  Court orders PSI and sentencing will be set out for 60 days.  Bond to continue.  See JA for sentencing date.
Plea hearing on June 7, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 10, 2016 at 10:45 am.

3:36 Defendant Donald F. Battin in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson appeared via phone.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Nelson would like condition of a bond to be lefted; the Def could return to his residence. Thorie: has no objection to dropping that restriction until noon on Sunday, January 17, 2016. All conditions to remain in effect. Nelson addresses the reason for the request.  Thorie will only willing to dropping the restriction of returning to the residence. Court: amends the bond conditions to remove the condition of the residence as of 12:00pm Sunday. January 17, 2016.

Defendant Donald F. Battin in Court from Jail with Attorney Lars Loberg and Attorney Liesl Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 2:02 p.m.  State presents Court with Information, Defendant waives further reading.  Atty. Nelson enters NG plea.  State advises that Defense wishes to have bond modified.  They have no objection to changing to signature bond but requests additional condition.  Atty. Nelson makes statement and requests bond modification.  Attorney Loberg states that he was court-appointed by the Judge and Atty. Nelson has now been appointed, requests substitution.  Court approves.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Donald F. Battin in Court from Jail with Attorney Lars Loberg and Attorney Liesl Nelson.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 1:58 p.m.  Atty. Nelson presents Court w/Waiver.  Court advises Defendant of right to Preliminary Hearing.  Defendant understands.  Court finds that Defendant has freely, intelligently and voluntarially waived right to Preliminary Hearing and binds Defendant over for trial.  Court proceeds to Arraignment.

records.addlTxt: 1:07  Defendant Donald F. Battin in court, in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court exams the defendant regarding the public defender. Defendant states he does not qualifiy for PD.  Def states he filled out the paperwork for court appt atty and gave to jailer. Clerk does not have it. Court explains waiver of the time limits to the defendant. Defendant waives the time limits for preliminary hearing. Court directs Officer Stewart to check at the jail and see if the application is in the jail. If not the defendant is to fill out a new application.  Bond to remain in present form.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

4:07  Defendant Donald F. Battin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Defendant Donald F. Battin in custody.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Bond conditions are reviewed with the defendant.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
